intro: Valerianella radiata var. umbilicata, commonly known as the common garden sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in gardens and disturbed areas. Its leaves are edible and have a tangy, sour flavor, making it a popular addition to salads and culinary dishes.
